## PHQ-9 vs SCAN

In the world of psychological research, making accurate and valid comparisons between different assessment tools is vital. Enter the PHQ-9 vs SCAN debate. The PHQ-9, or Patient Health Questionnaire, is a popular, self-assessed tool often used to diagnose common mental disorders. On the other hand, the Schedules for Clinical Assessment in Neuropsychiatry (SCAN) consists of over 1800 possible items, providing a more comprehensive, though perhaps wider, scope. While both have their merits, comparing their effectiveness and appropriateness in various scenarios can be challenging and time-consuming. This is where Harmony steps in. Harmony uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to compare different psychological scales, facilitating rapid and accurate comparisons. For those involved in the PHQ-9 vs SCAN debate, Harmony can provide a percentage match between each item, highlighting similarities and differences between the two scales. Not only does this save researchers invaluable time, but it eliminates the risk of subjectivity in the harmonisation process. Understanding the nuances in PHQ-9 vs SCAN can drive more robust, reliable and globally relevant research outcomes. Moreover, Harmony's capabilities extend beyond language boundaries, offering comparative analyses in multiple languages. This feature can provide key insights and enhance understanding when contextualizing PHQ-9 vs SCAN within international studies. With Harmony, psychologists and social scientists can easily compare, contrast, and find the right balance between these two vital tools in their research arsenal. Visit https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app, select scales from their extensive database or upload your own to make your PHQ-9 vs SCAN comparison journey seamless and straightforward.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and SCAN

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import PHQ-9 and SCAN into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PHQ-9 into Harmony</a> - compare PHQ-9 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SCAN into Harmony</a> - compare SCAN with other instruments
